intro: Vincetoxicum erubescens, commonly known as red bittersweet, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange berries that appear in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found along stream banks and in shaded woodlands. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
